findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract does not tolerate potential revert from underlying contracts when interaction is part of main transfer flow.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH. If `swapTokensAtAmount` is set to a big number, it can trigger a huge token swap, leading to significant price volatility due to the token's highly volatile price.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to decrease gas consumption and ensure the value of a state variable cannot be changed after it has been set.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract does not validate variable setters, which can lead to unexpected behavior or errors if variables are configured with zero value.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: The transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful according to the ERC20 specification.
